column4: hey gang... so i'm trying to print out my resume but openoffice is totally ignoring the top margin, so the first line is printed flush against the top of the page... i've even tried putting leading spaces before the document but they're being totally ignored by the printer.  any idea what i'm doing wrong?
long shot here but you could try google docs and see if its openoffice related or your printer drivers
good call, i'll give it a shot
openoffice is kind of iffy with ms office docs, least with my experience
i started my resume in openoffice so it's not a compatibility issue
sounds like printer drivers
i was just thinking that
i had to use a driver that wasn't for my printer model to get the bastard to prind
print*
i could never get the gui printer options to work in System menu, i just went right to cups http://localhost:631/
yeah printing in ubuntu is a joke
i have winxp in VM when I need to do odd ball printing
yeah i dual boot winxp for weird occurances like this bit it's on a busted hard drive that likes to give me migranes
yeah dont get me wrong i like ubuntu but its nowhere near perfect
i have to use winxp in virualbox because of quickbooks :P
despite it's flaws it's still less of a headache than winblows
they both have flaws =D
i've never really tried to mess with a vm, i'm running kind of a low-spec box
i dunno im running on amd64 3200+ x2 which is damn old
any tips on a good vm prog?
virtualbox runs great for me, get the one directly from Sun not the VB that is in Ubuntu Software Center
easy to find on google?
yeah the one from Sun adds USB support and other things
